column5: message

Merge pull request #64 from nfnt/update-readme

Update README.
Update README.
Update Travis configuration.
Support 411 and 410 subsampling rations for go1.5+

Don't resize inputs with zero width or height

Inputs having zero as both width and height were caught, but either one
alone caused a panic. This adds a test showing the old failing behavior
and adds a check for non-positive width/height. Since Resize doesn't
have an error return value, the behavior in this case is to return the
original image.

Fixes https://github.com/nfnt/resize/issues/52
Oops
Reverse alpha premultiplication

Merge pull request #34 from minodisk/master

Fix wrong color with RGBA input
Test same color with some color modes
Fix wrong color with RGBA input

Merge branch 'alpha_channel_fix'

Colors in image.RGBA, image.RGBA64 and generic types with alpha channel should
now resize correctly. There's a small performance hit for these image types even
if they don't use alpha channels though.
Fixes bug #26.

Merge branch 'NRGBA_support'

This adds optimized access to image.NRGBA, image.NRGBA64 types. Internally these
image types are now preferred as they are easier to handle if alpha channels are
used.
Mention optimized access for image.NRGBA, image.NRGBA64 in README.
Remove debugging directives.

Reverse alpha-premultiplication for image.RGBA, image.RGBA64 and generic images
types.
Add test case for input data with pre-multiplied-alpha.
Dst pixel coordinate fix
Merge branch 'optimization'

Limit spawned goroutines to GOMAXPROCS(0).

This change sets the number of spawned goroutines to the GOMAXPROCS
value set by the user.

Using more goroutines than available execution threads is slightly
detrimental to performance (~0.5%), and prevents users of the library
from controlling the number of spawned goroutines.

Optimize bound checks.

Optimizing the bound checks resulted in an overall 14% increase in
conversion performance.

Update benchmarks to focus on conversion performance.

Benchmark each interpolation function for RGBA and YCbCr images.
Reduce the image size used when benchmarking to reduce the influence of
memory performance on results.
Use SVG version badge for Travis CI
Merge branch 'YCC'
Fix bound out of range panic.
Merge branch 'YCC'
Fix YCC SubImage.
Merge branch 'YCC'
Fix error in YCC PixOffset and SubImage.
Merge branch 'refactor'
Optimize YCbCr image resize
Merge branch 'refactor'
Optimized Nearest-Neighbor function - 2x faster

Pre-calculate start offset, optimize bound check

Increased performance by 30% for RGBA and 45% for Gray images, minor
performance increase for 16-bit images.

The start offset calculated by createWeights are stored in a slice and
passed to the resize functions to prevent duplication of effort.
Fix to resize correctly when source image.Bounds().Min is not (0,0)
Add: thumbnail helper function

Use a lookup table to speed up the Lanczos kernel

Profiling the resize operation using Lanczos kernels showed that most of
the time was spent in the Sin function, which is called twice per
evaluation of the Lanczos kernel. Generating a lookup table and doing a
linear interpolation between table entries speeds up the resize by a
factor of 4.

Improve the way the new canvas size is calculated

If both dimensions are given, always use those dimensions, avoiding roundoff
error.

If only one dimension is given, slightly prefer rounding the other dimension
up, to rounding it down.
Center the resized image on the canvas, instead of shifting it slightly
